Class InFlightMovies

  • java.lang.Object
    • InFlightMovies

  • public class InFlightMovies
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a test class for In-flight entertainment system Imagine that you are working for an airline company. Lately they are receiving complaints from their customers regarding the in-flight entertainment system. The issue is that for the longer flights users would like to start a second movie when their first one ends, but the plane usually lands before they can see the ending.

    This class will choose N movies whose total time is equal with the exact flight length. It has 3 input parameters:

    • An array of integers that represents the time in minutes for each movie
    • The flight length in minutes
    • The number of movies to 'fit' into the flight duration
    The output is a boolean that will indicate if there are N movies whose sum equals the flight length. The user is watching exactly N movies The user should not watch the same movie twice

    Author:
    Luis Barreira

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method to find N number of movies that fit exactly into a flight duration
        Parameters:
        args - the command line argument: [0] the total duration for the flight in minutes [1] the number of movies to fit into the flight duration [2] the array for flight movies duration in minutes

      • moviesFitIntoDuration

        private static boolean moviesFitIntoDuration(int[] moviesDuration,
                                             int flightDuration,
                                             int moviesCount,
                                             int lastIdx)
        Returns true if there is a subset of moviesDuration[] with sum equal to flightDuration, and the subset is of length equal to moviesCount. This method is recursive and will start by analyzing the end of moviesDuration array and subtracting it from the flightDuration, at same time decreasing moviesCount by 1 for each value found. It will proceed until flightDuration and moviesCount are both 0.

        Parameters:
        moviesDuration - the array for flight movies duration in minutes
        flightDuration - the total duration for the flight in minutes
        moviesCount - the number of movies to fit into the flight duration
        lastIdx - the last index of the moviesDuration array to take into consideration
        Returns:
        true if a subset of movies was found that match both movies count and flight duration
